trans-unit.source: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using Azure portal | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using Azure portal | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to administer HDInsight Service.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to administer HDInsight Service.

trans-unit.source: Create an HDInsight cluster, open the interactive JavaScript console, and open the Hadoop command console.
trans-unit.target: Create an HDInsight cluster, open the interactive JavaScript console, and open the Hadoop command console.

trans-unit.source: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Using the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), you can provision Hadoop clusters in Azure HDInsight, change Hadoop user password, and enable Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) so you can access the Hadoop command console on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Using the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), you can provision Hadoop clusters in Azure HDInsight, change Hadoop user password, and enable Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) so you can access the Hadoop command console on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: Other tools for administering HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Other tools for administering HDInsight

trans-unit.source: There are also other tools available for administering HDInsight in addition to the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: There are also other tools available for administering HDInsight in addition to the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: For more information on administering HDInsight by using Azure PowerShell, see [Administer HDInsight Using Azure PowerShell](hdinsight-administer-use-powershell.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on administering HDInsight by using Azure PowerShell, see [Administer HDInsight Using Azure PowerShell](hdinsight-administer-use-powershell.md).

trans-unit.source: For more information on administering HDInsight by using the Azure CLI, see [Administer HDInsight Using Azure CLI](hdinsight-administer-use-command-line.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on administering HDInsight by using the Azure CLI, see [Administer HDInsight Using Azure CLI](hdinsight-administer-use-command-line.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **An Azure subscription**.
trans-unit.target: **An Azure subscription**.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: **Azure Storage account** - An HDInsight cluster uses an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Storage account** - An HDInsight cluster uses an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how Azure Blob storage provides a seamless experience with HDInsight clusters, see [Use Azure Blob Storage with HDInsight](../hdinsight-use-blob-storage.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about how Azure Blob storage provides a seamless experience with HDInsight clusters, see [Use Azure Blob Storage with HDInsight](../hdinsight-use-blob-storage.md).

trans-unit.source: For details on creating an Azure Storage account, see [How to Create a Storage Account](../storage-create-storage-account.md).
trans-unit.target: For details on creating an Azure Storage account, see [How to Create a Storage Account](../storage-create-storage-account.md).

trans-unit.source: Provision HDInsight clusters
trans-unit.target: Provision HDInsight clusters

trans-unit.source: You can provision HDInsight clusters from the Azure portal by using the Quick Create or Custom Create option.
trans-unit.target: You can provision HDInsight clusters from the Azure portal by using the Quick Create or Custom Create option.

trans-unit.source: See the following links for instructions:
trans-unit.target: See the following links for instructions:

trans-unit.source: Provision a cluster by using Quick Create
trans-unit.target: Provision a cluster by using Quick Create

trans-unit.source: Provision a cluster by using Custom Create
trans-unit.target: Provision a cluster by using Custom Create

trans-unit.source: Customize HDInsight clusters
trans-unit.target: Customize HDInsight clusters

trans-unit.source: HDInsight works with a wide range of Hadoop components.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight works with a wide range of Hadoop components.

trans-unit.source: For the list of the components that have been verified and supported, see [What version of Hadoop is in Azure HDInsight](hdinsight-component-versioning.md).
trans-unit.target: For the list of the components that have been verified and supported, see [What version of Hadoop is in Azure HDInsight](hdinsight-component-versioning.md).

trans-unit.source: You can customize HDInsight by using one of the following options:
trans-unit.target: You can customize HDInsight by using one of the following options:

trans-unit.source: Use Script Action to run custom scripts that can customize a cluster to either change cluster configuration or install custom components such as Giraph or Solr.
trans-unit.target: Use Script Action to run custom scripts that can customize a cluster to either change cluster configuration or install custom components such as Giraph or Solr.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the cluster customization parameters in the HDInsight .NET SDK or Azure PowerShell during cluster provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Use the cluster customization parameters in the HDInsight .NET SDK or Azure PowerShell during cluster provisioning.

trans-unit.source: These configuration changes are then preserved through the lifetime of the cluster and are not affected by cluster node reimages that Azure platform periodically performs for maintenance.
trans-unit.target: These configuration changes are then preserved through the lifetime of the cluster and are not affected by cluster node reimages that Azure platform periodically performs for maintenance.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using the cluster customization parameters, see [Provision HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using the cluster customization parameters, see [Provision HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md).

trans-unit.source: Some native Java components, like Mahout and Cascading, can be run on the cluster as JAR files.
trans-unit.target: Some native Java components, like Mahout and Cascading, can be run on the cluster as JAR files.

trans-unit.source: These JAR files can be distributed to Azure Blob storage, and submitted to HDInsight clusters through Hadoop job submission mechanisms.
trans-unit.target: These JAR files can be distributed to Azure Blob storage, and submitted to HDInsight clusters through Hadoop job submission mechanisms.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Submit Hadoop jobs programmatically](hdinsight-submit-hadoop-jobs-programmatically.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Submit Hadoop jobs programmatically](hdinsight-submit-hadoop-jobs-programmatically.md).

trans-unit.source: Installation of custom software on the cluster by using Remote Desktop Connection is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Installation of custom software on the cluster by using Remote Desktop Connection is not supported.

trans-unit.source: You should avoid storing any files on the drives of the head node, as they will be lost if you need to re-create the clusters.
trans-unit.target: You should avoid storing any files on the drives of the head node, as they will be lost if you need to re-create the clusters.

trans-unit.source: We recommend storing files on Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: We recommend storing files on Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: Blob storage is persistent.
trans-unit.target: Blob storage is persistent.

trans-unit.source: Change the HDInsight cluster user name and password
trans-unit.target: Change the HDInsight cluster user name and password

trans-unit.source: An HDInsight cluster can have two user accounts.
trans-unit.target: An HDInsight cluster can have two user accounts.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight cluster user account is created during the provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight cluster user account is created during the provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: You can also create an RDP user account for accessing the cluster via RDP.
trans-unit.target: You can also create an RDP user account for accessing the cluster via RDP.

trans-unit.source: See [Enable remote desktop](#connect-to-hdinsight-clusters-by-using-rdp).
trans-unit.target: See [Enable remote desktop](#connect-to-hdinsight-clusters-by-using-rdp).

trans-unit.source: To change the HDInsight cluster user name and password
trans-unit.target: To change the HDInsight cluster user name and password

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Click **HDINSIGHT** on the left pane.
trans-unit.target: Click **HDINSIGHT** on the left pane.

trans-unit.source: You will see a list of deployed HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: You will see a list of deployed HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Click the HDInsight cluster that you want to reset the user name and password for.
trans-unit.target: Click the HDInsight cluster that you want to reset the user name and password for.

trans-unit.source: From the top of the page, click **CONFIGURATION**.
trans-unit.target: From the top of the page, click **CONFIGURATION**.

trans-unit.source: Click **OFF** next to **HADOOP SERVICES**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OFF** next to **HADOOP SERVICES**.

trans-unit.source: Click **SAVE** on the bottom of the page, and wait for the disabling to finish.
trans-unit.target: Click **SAVE** on the bottom of the page, and wait for the disabling to finish.

trans-unit.source: After the service has been disabled, click **ON** next to **HADOOP SERVICES**.
trans-unit.target: After the service has been disabled, click **ON** next to **HADOOP SERVICES**.

trans-unit.source: For **USER NAME** and **NEW PASSWORD**, enter the new user name and password (respectively) for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: For **USER NAME** and **NEW PASSWORD**, enter the new user name and password (respectively) for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click **SAVE**.
trans-unit.target: Click **SAVE**.

trans-unit.source: Connect to HDInsight clusters by using RDP
trans-unit.target: Connect to HDInsight clusters by using RDP

trans-unit.source: The credentials for the cluster that you provided at its creation give access to the services on the cluster, but not to the cluster itself through Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: The credentials for the cluster that you provided at its creation give access to the services on the cluster, but not to the cluster itself through Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: Remote Desktop access is turned off by default, and so direct access to the cluster using it requires some additional, post-creation configuration.
trans-unit.target: Remote Desktop access is turned off by default, and so direct access to the cluster using it requires some additional, post-creation configuration.

trans-unit.source: To enable Remote Desktop
trans-unit.target: To enable Remote Desktop

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Click **HDINSIGHT** on the left pane.
trans-unit.target: Click **HDINSIGHT** on the left pane.

trans-unit.source: You will see a list of deployed HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: You will see a list of deployed HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Click the HDInsight cluster that you want to connect to.
trans-unit.target: Click the HDInsight cluster that you want to connect to.

trans-unit.source: From the top of the page, click **CONFIGURATION**.
trans-unit.target: From the top of the page, click **CONFIGURATION**.

trans-unit.source: From the bottom of the page, click **ENABLE REMOTE**.
trans-unit.target: From the bottom of the page, click **ENABLE REMOTE**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Configure Remote Desktop** wizard, enter a user name and password for the remote desktop.
trans-unit.target: In the **Configure Remote Desktop** wizard, enter a user name and password for the remote desktop.

trans-unit.source: Note that the user name must be different from the one used to create the cluster (**admin** by default with the Quick Create option).
trans-unit.target: Note that the user name must be different from the one used to create the cluster (**admin** by default with the Quick Create option).

trans-unit.source: Enter an expiration date in the **EXPIRES ON** box.
trans-unit.target: Enter an expiration date in the **EXPIRES ON** box.

trans-unit.source: Note that the expiration date must be in the future and up to 90 days from today.
trans-unit.target: Note that the expiration date must be in the future and up to 90 days from today.

trans-unit.source: The expiration time of day is assumed by default to be midnight of the specified date.
trans-unit.target: The expiration time of day is assumed by default to be midnight of the specified date.

trans-unit.source: Then click the check icon.
trans-unit.target: Then click the check icon.

trans-unit.source: HDI.CreateRDPUser
trans-unit.target: HDI.CreateRDPUser

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can also use the HDInsight .NET SDK to enable Remote Desktop on a cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can also use the HDInsight .NET SDK to enable Remote Desktop on a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the **EnableRdp** method on the HDInsight client object in the following manner: **client.EnableRdp(clustername, location, "rdpuser", "rdppassword", DateTime.Now.AddDays(6))**.
trans-unit.target: Use the **EnableRdp** method on the HDInsight client object in the following manner: **client.EnableRdp(clustername, location, "rdpuser", "rdppassword", DateTime.Now.AddDays(6))**.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, to disable Remote Desktop on the cluster, you can use **client.DisableRdp(clustername, location)**.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, to disable Remote Desktop on the cluster, you can use **client.DisableRdp(clustername, location)**.

trans-unit.source: For more information on these methods, see [HDInsight .NET SDK Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529017).
trans-unit.target: For more information on these methods, see [HDInsight .NET SDK Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529017).

trans-unit.source: This is applicable only for HDInsight clusters running on Windows.
trans-unit.target: This is applicable only for HDInsight clusters running on Windows.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Once RDP is enabled for a cluster, you must refresh the page before you can connect to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Once RDP is enabled for a cluster, you must refresh the page before you can connect to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: To connect to a cluster by using RDP
trans-unit.target: To connect to a cluster by using RDP

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Click **HDINSIGHT** on the left pane.
trans-unit.target: Click **HDINSIGHT** on the left pane.

trans-unit.source: You will see a list of deployed HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: You will see a list of deployed HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Click the HDInsight cluster that you want to connect to.
trans-unit.target: Click the HDInsight cluster that you want to connect to.

trans-unit.source: From the top of the page, click **CONFIGURATION**.
trans-unit.target: From the top of the page, click **CONFIGURATION**.

trans-unit.source: Click **CONNECT**, and then follow the instructions.
trans-unit.target: Click **CONNECT**, and then follow the instructions.

trans-unit.source: Create a self-signed certificate
trans-unit.target: Create a self-signed certificate

trans-unit.source: If you want to perform any operations on the cluster by using the .NET SDK, you must create a self-signed certificate on the workstation, and also upload the certificate to your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: If you want to perform any operations on the cluster by using the .NET SDK, you must create a self-signed certificate on the workstation, and also upload the certificate to your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: This is a one-time task.
trans-unit.target: This is a one-time task.

trans-unit.source: You can install the same certificate on other machines, as long as the certificate is valid.
trans-unit.target: You can install the same certificate on other machines, as long as the certificate is valid.

trans-unit.source: To create a self-signed certificate
trans-unit.target: To create a self-signed certificate

trans-unit.source: Create a self-signed certificate that is used to authenticate the requests.
trans-unit.target: Create a self-signed certificate that is used to authenticate the requests.

trans-unit.source: You can use Internet Information Services (IIS) or [makecert]( http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=534000) to create the certificate.
trans-unit.target: You can use Internet Information Services (IIS) or [makecert]( http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=534000) to create the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the location of the certificate, right-click the certificate, click **Install Certificate**, and install the certificate to the computer's personal store.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the location of the certificate, right-click the certificate, click **Install Certificate**, and install the certificate to the computer's personal store.

trans-unit.source: Edit the certificate properties to assign it a friendly name.
trans-unit.target: Edit the certificate properties to assign it a friendly name.

trans-unit.source: Import the certificate into the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Import the certificate into the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: From the portal, click **SETTINGS** on the bottom left of the page, and then click **MANAGEMENT CERTIFICATES**.
trans-unit.target: From the portal, click **SETTINGS** on the bottom left of the page, and then click **MANAGEMENT CERTIFICATES**.

trans-unit.source: From the bottom of the page, click **UPLOAD** and follow the instructions to upload the .cer file you created in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: From the bottom of the page, click **UPLOAD** and follow the instructions to upload the .cer file you created in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: HDI.ClusterCreate.UploadCert
trans-unit.target: HDI.ClusterCreate.UploadCert

trans-unit.source: Grant/revoke HTTP services access
trans-unit.target: Grant/revoke HTTP services access

trans-unit.source: HDInsight clusters have the following HTTP web services (all of these services have RESTful endpoints):
trans-unit.target: HDInsight clusters have the following HTTP web services (all of these services have RESTful endpoints):

trans-unit.source: ODBC
trans-unit.target: ODBC

trans-unit.source: JDBC
trans-unit.target: JDBC

trans-unit.source: Ambari
trans-unit.target: Ambari

trans-unit.source: Oozie
trans-unit.target: Oozie

trans-unit.source: Templeton
trans-unit.target: Templeton

trans-unit.source: By default, these services are granted for access.
trans-unit.target: By default, these services are granted for access.

trans-unit.source: You can revoke/grant the access from the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: You can revoke/grant the access from the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] By granting/revoking the access, you will reset the cluster user name and password.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] By granting/revoking the access, you will reset the cluster user name and password.

trans-unit.source: To grant/revoke HTTP web services access
trans-unit.target: To grant/revoke HTTP web services access

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Click **HDINSIGHT** on the left pane.
trans-unit.target: Click **HDINSIGHT** on the left pane.

trans-unit.source: You will see a list of deployed HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: You will see a list of deployed HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Click the HDInsight cluster that you want to configure.
trans-unit.target: Click the HDInsight cluster that you want to configure.

trans-unit.source: From the top of the page, click **CONFIGURATION**.
trans-unit.target: From the top of the page, click **CONFIGURATION**.

trans-unit.source: Click **ON** or **OFF** next to **HADOOP SERVICES**.
trans-unit.target: Click **ON** or **OFF** next to **HADOOP SERVICES**.

trans-unit.source: For **USER NAME** and **NEW PASSWORD**, enter the new user name and password (respectively) for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: For **USER NAME** and **NEW PASSWORD**, enter the new user name and password (respectively) for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click **SAVE**.
trans-unit.target: Click **SAVE**.

trans-unit.source: This can also be done through the Azure PowerShell cmdlets:
trans-unit.target: This can also be done through the Azure PowerShell cmdlets:

trans-unit.source: Grant-AzureHDInsightHttpServicesAccess
trans-unit.target: Grant-AzureHDInsightHttpServicesAccess

trans-unit.source: Revoke-AzureHDInsightHttpServicesAccess
trans-unit.target: Revoke-AzureHDInsightHttpServicesAccess

trans-unit.source: See [Administer HDInsight using Azure PowerShell](hdinsight-administer-use-powershell.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Administer HDInsight using Azure PowerShell](hdinsight-administer-use-powershell.md).

trans-unit.source: Open a Hadoop command line
trans-unit.target: Open a Hadoop command line

trans-unit.source: To connect to the cluster by using Remote Desktop and use the Hadoop command line, you must first have enabled Remote Desktop access to the cluster as described in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the cluster by using Remote Desktop and use the Hadoop command line, you must first have enabled Remote Desktop access to the cluster as described in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: To open a Hadoop command line
trans-unit.target: To open a Hadoop command line

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Click **HDINSIGHT** on the left pane.
trans-unit.target: Click **HDINSIGHT** on the left pane.

trans-unit.source: You will see a list of deployed Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: You will see a list of deployed Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Click the HDInsight cluster that you want to connect to.
trans-unit.target: Click the HDInsight cluster that you want to connect to.

trans-unit.source: Click **CONFIGURATION** on the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **CONFIGURATION** on the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click **CONNECT** on the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **CONNECT** on the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click **Open**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Open**.

trans-unit.source: Enter your credentials, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Enter your credentials, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Use the user name and password you configured when you created the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Use the user name and password you configured when you created the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: From the desktop, double-click **Hadoop Command Line**.
trans-unit.target: From the desktop, double-click **Hadoop Command Line**.

trans-unit.source: HDI.HadoopCommandLine
trans-unit.target: HDI.HadoopCommandLine

trans-unit.source: In the previous screenshot, the folder name has the Hadoop version number embedded.
trans-unit.target: In the previous screenshot, the folder name has the Hadoop version number embedded.

trans-unit.source: The version number can changed based on the version of the Hadoop components installed on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The version number can changed based on the version of the Hadoop components installed on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can use Hadoop environment variables to refer to those folders.
trans-unit.target: You can use Hadoop environment variables to refer to those folders.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Scale clusters
trans-unit.target: Scale clusters

trans-unit.source: See [Scale Hadoop clusters in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-cluster-scaling.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Scale Hadoop clusters in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-cluster-scaling.md).

trans-unit.target: In this article, you have learned how to create an HDInsight cluster by using the Azure portal, and how to open the Hadoop command-line tool.
